= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= woman employed to have sexual intercourse with other people as part of local fertility rites; ► forbidden under Mosaic law

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= the male young of a goat (עֵז)
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.definition: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

= wife of one's son

Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= father of one's spouse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which someone is pregnant

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= engraved object; ◄ made out of metal; ► used to make a mark denoting ownership, approval, or closure of something (normally done by pressing into clay or heated wax and usually attached to a document or letter); sometimes worn on a chain around the neck, or in the form of a ring on one's hand; ≈ regarded as valuable and associated with exclusivity
= relatively thin cord ◄ made of cotton, wool, flax or precious metal; ► used for attaching objects to clothes, hanging small objects around the neck, measuring, tying, etc.
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler; also used for threshing; ≈ associated with authority and punishment
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= man, possibly to be identified with Shiloh (שִׁילֹה) ◄ third son of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
literally: to know (someone physically); hence: = action by which two people have sexual relations with one another
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= two children or young animals born at the same birth
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= person who assists women during childbirth
= causative actions by which humans attach ropes to other objects

literally: to go out (from the womb); hence: = process by which children are born
